conclusion: Analyze the given x-t graph to determine the car's acceleration from the start of timing.
The graph shows the position of the car as a function of time.
The position at the start of timing is -2 meters.
The position at any given time t can be found by reading the corresponding point on the graph.
The acceleration a is given by the slope of the tangent line to the graph at any point.
The slope of the tangent line at any point on the graph represents the instantaneous rate of change of position with respect to time, which is the acceleration.
The slope of the tangent line at the start of timing is the change in position divided by the change in time.
The change in position is x at t = 0 (which is -2 meters).
The change in time is t at t = 0 (which is 0 seconds).
The slope of the tangent line at the start of timing is -2/0, which is undefined.
Since the slope is undefined at the start of timing, we need to find the slope at a later point on the graph.
The slope of the tangent line at any point on the graph represents the instantaneous acceleration.
The slope of the tangent line at any point on the graph is the change in position divided by the change in time.
The change in position is x at t = 10 seconds (which is 10 meters).
The change in time is t at t = 10 seconds (which is 10 seconds).
The slope of the tangent line at t = 10 seconds is 10/10 = 1.
The acceleration a is given by the slope of the tangent line.
The acceleration at t = 10 seconds is 1 m/s².
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 1 m/s².
